dt: {bc}an electronic device that adds a {d_link|backbeat|backbeat}, manipulates sounds, and mimics musical instruments

dt.t: … loops and layers her voice and music with a {wi}beatbox{/wi}, small keyboard/synth and a laptop …

dt: {bc}a person who vocally imitates percussion sounds {bc}{sx|beatboxer||}

dt.t: When we first started, I was the {wi}beatbox{/wi}, Treach was the MC, and Kay Gee was the DJ.
… he layers many of the 15 songs here with his entirely voice-generated rhythm tracks, turning himself into what rappers call a human {wi}beatbox{/wi}.

dt: {bc}the performance of such a vocal imitation

dt.t: … smashed the world record for the longest continuous {wi}beatbox{/wi} …
"… My friends there were performing on the downtown scene. One had a piece of spoken word and I said, 'I'll do this {wi}beatbox{/wi} and dance next to it.' …"
The event also will include entertainment by campus dancers, a cappella singers and a vocal {wi}beatbox{/wi} performer.
Equally impressive was runner-up George Avakian who, during his {wi}beatbox{/wi} performance, instructed viewers to "watch five sounds come out of one human's mouth"—simultaneously, mind you …
This five-person professional a cappella singing group … transforms familiar pop, funk, Motown, standards, and Broadway songs with all-new vocal (and {wi}beatbox{/wi}) arrangements.
On the other side of the pool, an American tourist put a cassette in his {wi}beatbox{/wi}. (This was a time before iPods and the internet.)

shortdef: an electronic device that adds a backbeat, manipulates sounds, and mimics musical instruments
a person who vocally imitates percussion sounds : beatboxer; also : the performance of such a vocal imitation —often used before another noun

dt.t: On top of that impressive instrumental work, he {wi}beatboxed{/wi}! … How one can physically make those sounds, we might never know.
Lewis {wi}beatboxes{/wi} into Time of the Season. He grabs an acoustic guitar and sings She Will Be Loved.

[Ben] Broussard released a self-titled folk album late last year. But he's not confined to one genre. Says his former teammate, [Cincinnati] Reds infielder Brandon Phillips: "The dude can seriously {wi}beatbox{/wi}. …"

shortdef: to vocally imitate percussion sounds : to perform beatboxing
